id: Trust, episode 7 review: a slow-moving hour-long flashback carried by a spellbinding Donald Sutherland
paragraph:
Going into episode seven of Trust (BBC Two), the drama inspired by the kidnapping of 16-year-old John Paul Getty III in 1973, we knew two things. First, that the boy’s miserly, manipulative, billionaire grandfather had just negotiated down the mafia’s ransom demands in person. And second, that in a typically sadistic twist, he now intended to make his drug-addled derelict of a son Paul, the boy’s father, raise the $5 million by himself.It was all too typical of this series’ languid approach to storytelling that by the episode’s end we still hadn’t progressed a jot further than this in terms of plot.
